desc: Through exploring the geographic and human diversity of the Spanish-speaking world, students develop increasingly complex skills for analyzing and communicating in Spanish. They study such essential dimensions of that world as: (1) geography and development; (2) environmental challenges and solutions; (3) population and demographic changes and challenges; and (4) ethnic diversity. Offered each semester and during Interim. Prerequisite: SPAN 112 or placement.
name: Intermed Spanish I
notes: Open to all students who meet the prerequisites. Prerequisite: completion of Spanish placement test or preceding course.

revisions.notes: Open to all students who meet the prerequisites. Prerequisite: completion of Spanish placement test or preceding course. This course has class-year limits.

title: Intermediate Spanish I
